#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Burst pipe
#Text=probed in Utah refinery blast as questions asked over safety
#Text=Sunday , November 8 , 2009

#Text=Federal investigators with the Chemical Safety Board ( CSB ) of the United States have declared that a recent explosion that damaged homes alongside a Woods Cross , Utah refinery was triggered when a pipe burst .
#Text=The revelation comes as locals begin questioning the decision to build houses near the facility .
#Text=The explosion at the Silver Eagle refinery on Wednesday morning was the second next year , and blasted a fireball into the neighbourhood .
#Text=Ten houses suffered damage including cracked foundations , roofs lifted off , doors and windows blown out and debris hurled into rooms .
#Text=One resident , Linda Wood , has been told to leave her house , which lies condemned after it was knocked clear of its foundations and damaged structurally .
#Text=Two local emergency dispatch centers were clogged up as calls came through to the 911 emergency number .
#Text=Firefighters arrived quickly and tackled the resulting blaze at the refinery after establishing that there were no injuries .
#Text=The 1950s refinery was not evacuated and is expected to continue operating despite the damage .
#Text=It employs 80 people .
#Text=Silver Eagle 's own firefighting crews were already in control when they were joined by the emergency services , and together they put the flames out in around thirty minutes .
#Text=Woods Cross mayor Kent Perry said that over the last six months there have been a lot of improvements in local firefighting and praised the reaction of emergency services .
#Text=Later , 120 residents were visited by structural engineers to assess damage .
#Text=There were also power outages in the area , with two other refineries amongst those affected .
#Text=Silver Eagle had also sent employees on a firefighting course following another explosion in January .
#Text=In that accident , a large cloud of flammable vapour developed over a tank of naptha before igniting , causing a flash fire that injured several employees .
#Text=The firm has said they will pay for all the damages caused by the latest incident , and Perry advised affected people to keep track of expenses incurred .
#Text=As well as the CSB , Utah 's Occupational Safety and Health Administration and Silver Eagle themselves are investigating the accident .
#Text=The CSB released preliminary findings yesterday that indicated a burst pipe was to blame , although the reasons for its failure are unknown .
#Text=A pipe ten inches in diameter burst along a horizontal section near a point where it changed direction from vertical .

#Text=The pipe normally carried hydrogen and diesel and was linked to a reactor that took waxes out of diesel fuel , but due to maintenance by Silver Eagle the pipe was only transporting pressurised hydrogen .
#Text=When it failed at 9:15 630 pounds of hydrogen spilled out and were ignited by a nearby furnace .
#Text=The resulting 800 degrees Fahrenheit fireball leapt 100 feet into the air and sent a string of pressure waves to buffet the housing , as the pipe pointed east towards the homes .
#Text=The CSB 's Donald Holmstrom commented that " The unit was immediately engulfed in flames ...
